Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the solution could be simple!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the problem is that the secret is revealed and thus making the entropy tx basically have no entropy as it is a constant

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so what we need to do is invalidate any entropy value that has been used before

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if each online node could make a list of all bettxid with the matched dealer entropy and then refuse to accept any other bettxid using the same entropy, this 51% attack is thwarted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: my unsolved issue is how to do this in a consensus safe way...

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: We would not have to archive entropy values with this method?

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so not a big archive

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but getting all nodes to the same archive state, is the unsolved problem now

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one way is for the dealer node to just create a summary tx(s) each block with this info. since the dealer creates this, it cant be double spent by the attacker and even on reorg and mining domination, it will end up in the mempool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but mempools isnt 100% consensus safe...

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: Observing mempool?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
the sequence is:
0) entropy tx is created with hash of entropy (hentropy)
1) player selects it and bets against it using entropy
2) dealer reveals entropy and completes the bet or
2b) dealer ignores it and it eventually times out and player wins by default

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so here, all we need to do is have the dealer add the following behavior:

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: record all rawtx, txid and entropy values used in 2)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if a duplicate entropy is seen (dealer will know this for sure) then instead of 2) he does 2c)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: submits proof of the older rawtx, txid, entropy to invalidate the bet and refund, so no money changes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since the rawtx was signed by the player, the dealer couldnt have made a forgery

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: Good, so no one can cheat. Why not if redundant entropy is found bet is automatic a loss?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but just in case there are edge cases, we refund all the funds, taking away the incentive to cheat

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: How big are chances for this to happen coincidentially?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i am not 100% sure that the dealers proof is sufficient in all cases

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess it can go either way, but the key is to protect the bankroll

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: I understand, that is the goal, and not punishment for cheaters.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and remember there is the nicehash cost, the failed attempts, that are out of pocket costs for cheaters

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after all that work they submit the 100% guaranteed win. only to have it proven a cheat and get nothing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: very discouraging

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for the attacker

Author: forkwitch#6080
Content: This is true. Maybe we add a output 'Gratulation you have tried to cheat and it was a good try' for the cheaters to get credits for the hard labour.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so this just needs a dicerefund rpc call that submits the proof of double usage, and dealer does this instead of dicefinish, it can even be determined in realtime just as quickly

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just need a third case for the dealer to finish a dicebet.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: wow, it seems after this KMDICE will be 100% solid from attacks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and the casino CC can implement the same fix, so however many game logic that can be done via 2 entropy hashes can be supported

Content: casinoslots, casinoroulette, casinowheel, etc. all the equivalent of dicebet, just using a different eval function

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I think dealer only needs to update the entropyarray of the dicebets he is about to finish, as that is when the entropy is revealed. so before updating the array, just check to see if the entropy was already used. if it was, then do a dicerefund with txproof and have it return funds to where they came from. so the dealer can actively and in realtime detect a reuse of a previously completed dicebet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since only the dealer can do a non-timeout finish, the dealer will always have an accurate list of entropy used

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: really it should be a dicerefund rpc call that requires sufficient proof for all the other nodes to validate put into opreturn

Author: jl777c#5810
